text: Rabbi Sigma Faye Coran (March 23, 1966 - May 8, 2020) was Senior Rabbi at Rockdale Temple, Amberley, Ohio. As such, she was the first woman to serve as the senior rabbi of a Cincinnati area congregation. ==Early life and education== Coran was born in St. Louis, Missouri and grew up in Akron, Ohio. She studied clinical psychology and biology at Tufts University. She was ordained at Hebrew Union College. ==Personal life== She married Rabbi Matthew Kraus with whom she had four children. ==Career== Coran served as Assistant Rabbi at Temple Emanuel in Worcester, Massachusetts from 1994 to 1999. Coran was appointed Senior Rabbi of Rockdale Temple, the oldest Jewish congregation in the United States west of the Allegheny Mountains, on July 1, 2004. As such, she was the first woman to serve as the senior rabbi of a Cincinnati area congregation. ==Death== Rabbi Sigma Faye Coran died on May 8, 2020 of metastatic breast cancer. ==References== Category:1966 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American rabbis Category:Clergy from St. Louis Category:People from Akron, Ohio Category:Hebrew Union College alumni Category:Tufts University alumni Category:Deaths from breast cancer Category:Women rabbis Category:21st-century rabbis
title: Sigma Faye Coran
